text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Intensywna, ściągająca kwasowość, skręcająca lekko w stronę octu. Wyraźnie mineralne.
MBCC. Slightly hazy deep yellow with no head. Aroma is malt, fruit, lemon, spices and salt. Flavour is malt,lemon, spices, little sweet, citric and notes of salt.
Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, blue session. Aroma has some floral and farmhouse notes. Taste is tart, floral, lemony with a light acacia note. Body is light and easy drinking.

Bottle @ MBCC 2017. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, light salt, light spice, hay, citrus. Flavor is light sour, little salt, wheat, yeast, spice, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light salty finish. 120517
[5/12/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Blue session. Yellow. Coriander, grains, citrus, mildly sourish, a bit salty. Refreshing.
Sample at MBCC2017. Hazy yellow with white head. Sour fruit and berries and light herbal (coriander?) and very light salty.
Sample @ MBCC, Blue session. Hazy light golden pour with a pale head. Notes of citrus, grains, yoghurt and light salty.
MBCC. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and tart. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 120517
Keg at cbc17 Blue.. Light yellow.. Thin white lacing... Dry salty fruits nose. Light sharp fruits.. Ligh tart fruits
Draught at MBCC 2017. Low fluffy lasting white head. Cloudy yellow body. Acidic lemon salt aroma and flavor. No hops bitterness, high carbonation, long finish.
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Semi-hazy golden pour with a white head. Notes of citrus, funk, salt, lemonade, sour berries. Refreshing.
Tap @MBCC2017, Blue Session. Clear light golden, white head. Light malt aroma, some fruityness, slightly doughy. Sweetish, pale malt and citrus flavour. Gose??
Tap @ MBC2017. Pours clear yellow. Aroma of coriander, salty, lemon, citrusy, clean sour. Taste is sour, tart, slight grains.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Tart smell with citrus. Similar taste. Rereshing. Light body.

duft: frisk citrus æble skrald 
smag frisk citrus lime tør æble sur lang tør smag
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Blue Session. Fast klare hell goldgelbe Farbe. Geruch ist mild säuerlich fruchtig, holzig, steinobst. Geschmack nach limetten, mild säuerlich, grüner Tee.

0,05l from tap at MBCC blue session shared with / by the crew. light yellow cloudy color, small white head. smells flowery, peppery, bit grassy. decent smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, grassy, light berry notes, bit medical. finishes lightly dry with notes of grass and citrus. decent overall, expected a bit more though.

6, 4, 7, 3, 14

12.05.2017, tap (2014) @ MBCC:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish fruity, soda powder, minerals, grape juice, fruit salt, hay, flowers, grass. Taste is slightly sour-ish mineraly, fruit salt, minerals, grass, soda powder, paper, grape juice, hay. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice enough.
Pours clear yellow with low white head. Aroma of salt, funk, tart. Taste is mild funky with a mellow tarty finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Golden pour, slightly hazy with a white head. Tart, lemon, fruity, coriander, and notes of salt. Pretty good.
[8144-20160416] Bottle. Fruity pasta aroma. Slightly hazy, light orange body with a quick bubbly head. Sour fruity flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 2016-04-16. Hazy bright yellow body, headless. 3+ Aroma is mild, fruity, gooseberry like notes. 7+ Flavour is lightly lactic, with muted salty accents. Smooth average plus bodied palate, soft to low carbonation. 3+ Not as complex as some (or perhaps it suffered in the midst of several other beers?) but a nice enjoyable take on the style. 7/3/7/3/14-15 Shared by Wilco.
Very nice tradition gose. Wheat, salty/briny, a bit of coriander, some tart lemon.
Golden spritz you pour. Aroma of spice wheat and coriander. Flavor is wheats and nuts, some spice and some salts but not much salt. Extremely refreshing. Great.

Willrunforbeer sharing this 750 ml. Cloudy gold/ orange color. Sour wheat, salt and coriander is all mild on the nose. Light lactic hints.  
The flavor is just as subtle has the aroma, low sourness, low lactic acid. Salt in the finish is also subtle. Mild old fruit notes. Body on the better side of medium with a soft mouthfeel. Never would guess it was 7.5 % ABV, imperial Gose?? Ha ha ha. For the age of this brew it doesnt show me any form of oxidation. Damn nice.

2012 750mL cork and cage. Pours light brown gold with a white head. Aroma is sour wheat, slight tropical fruit, salt. Flavor is wheat, mild tropical fruit, salt. Mild sourness, very easy drinking, smooth.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle 2012 project thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours hazy grapefruit color with a nice white head. Aromas of salt yeast funk and spice. Taste is smooth and balanced not too tart with a great cohesion and a nice lingering salt finish. Awesome beer.

Bottle bought in SF, February 2015. 

A bit hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste of salt, light fruit, some coriander and citrus. Also hints of hay. Soft and easy to drink. A good one.
@ Gyllenbock 15-7-22: Fin frisk syrlighet. Tydlig sälta i smaken. Trevlig munnkänsla och balans.

Dégustée chez Alexandre Mathieu. Cheers! Bière étonnamment foncée pour une Gose. Les couleurs sont proches du orangé ou même caramel et je perçois même quelques reflets verdâtres au travers de mon verre. Je suis très surpris. Mon verre est rempli de levures en suspension. Nez de pain frais qui une fois agrémenté de ce côté salin de la Gose, me fait penser à un Bretzel. Curieusement, en bouche le sel est manquant pour le style. Il était présent au nez mais en bouche trop discret. Javais peut-être trop dattentes. Beaucoup de ce sucre qui confère un corps curieusement rond à cette Gose, le reste est axé sur la coriandre et les levures. La signature Cascade demeure très présente bien que la bière ne soit pas vraiment une Gose à mon avis.

First shared a bottle with Jo & Doug, and again yesterday with Mikey .. . Lightly hazed gold .. Great goam foam .. Mild tartness, seaweed, sweet tarts, and furry hay .. . A real nice beer, nothing really like it- its just so cascade.. . . Looks like I picked the wrong week to stop sniffing glue..

Pours a hazy golden yellow with minimal bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma of sweet lactic sour with hints of coriander and earth. Taste follows with nice balance, spice isnt overboard, nice sour but not mouth puckering. Very impressive.

Tart lactic aroma with salty, lemon and slight spice. Taste is wheaty, lemony, salty, and of sour. Fairly sour, maybe 4 of 10 but I would say this is slightly less sour than say Westbrook gose, maybe about the same, but definitely not over the top sour. It is balanced and full flavored, and feels like a very authentic gose. With how puckering some other cascade beers are I was thinking this one might be more sour, but still great. That being said this is one of the best gose I have had, with Westbrook maybe edging it out? Maybe a tie. But Westbrook is $12 a 6 pack vs $25 a bottle. So at a 3rd the cost Westbrook wins. I love cascade. My favorite brewery overall, but for the cost I will buy their more complex sours. The gose is a lighter, more session able beer and the cost is prohibitive here. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with smal frothy white head. The aroma is funk, salt, lime juice. Medium mouth, lime, funk, salt, light tartness, very nice.
759 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow gold with light head. Aromas of coriander and green grapes. Flavors of dry dough, earthy yeast and coriander. Slightly tart and salty. Okay but not worth $40.

On tap at Cascade. Hazy yellow with a small pale head. Aroma is mandarin, salt, plum. Light bodied, thin mouthfeel, subtly fruity on the palate with a lightly salty finish. Taste is coriander, orange blossom.
Bottle shared by Nick. Hanging with friends so keeping this short. Hazy gold with white head. Metallic; coriander; citrus; tastes refreshingly salty-tart. Light body, prickly carbonation.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Légère odeur de citron et de lactose. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de citron avec une pointe de sel et de coriandre. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement citronné. (Rating #6182)

Bottle... Pours hazy and golden with a small, wispy, white head. Decent retention. The aroma is doughy, lightly grainy and mildly citric. Medium to full-bodied with busy carbonation. The flavor offers lightly sweet biscuits, a modest level of bitterness and faint acidity. Finishes bready with only a hint of tartness and a tiny pinch of salt. Bottle courtesy of growler. Thanks Scott!

750ml c&c bottle from www.craftbeerkings.com. Poured a milky/hazy yellow body under a smaller fizzy white head. Aroma is salty, sour lemon, lime, beach sand and a touch of milk. Flavor is the same but more limey than the aroma. Bigger bodied with strong carbonation and a yummy long lasting aftertaste. Good stuff.

This ended up being a mellow but very nice example of the style. More coriander than salt, and light hay/funk. Id think highly of it if you couldnt get comparable beers in this style for far less $$.

On tap at the barrel house. 

A: Cloudy yellow, foamy white head, no lacing. 

N: Green apple, salt, pear, lactic acid, sweet-tart, orange peel, grapefruit.

T: Salty, sour, sweet-tart. (Shocker)

M: Light body, tingling carbonation, a bit slick.

O: Decent Gose. Not in the same ballpark as Gose Gone Wild or even Block 15s spontaneous version. Basically a saltwater Cascade sour.

Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy lemon, citrus, sweet tarts, and a touch of minerals (but nothing I would distinguish as salt). It pours mostly transparent gold with just a touch of haze. It has a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin head. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus, sweet tarts, and a hint of cotton candy. The finish has moderate sour lemon with a touch of mineral salt. Its light bodied with light-moderate carbonation. Overall, this is one of the lightest 7.5% abv beers Ive ever had.

Bottle: 2012 Project. Thanks, Kevin. Cloudy, translucent golden body with a foamy, soapy white head that fades quickly to a collar. Aroma of tart lemon, soured wheat, sweet-tart candies, mineral water, lime, & stone fruit. Flavor is nice, tart, & light. Sour lemon-line, mineral water, dry & tart wheat, a slight hint of lacto & yogurt (mild), some faint acidic, though tame compared to most Cascade offerings. Dry finish of sour wheat, lemon candies, & a very small touch of salt. Not as much salt or coriander as a traditional "gose" but this is still a really tasty beer.

Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours cloudy yellow with an attractive white head and an herbal aroma. There is a slightly sour light fruit flavor with plenty of salt and coriander in the finish. Very drinkable.

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a cloudy yellow with a lingering ring of off white foam. Aromas of wheat, coriander, citrus and light salt. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of wheat, salt, coriander and citrus with a smooth dry light tart lingering salty citrus finish.

750 c&c from Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours light translucent gold with a white head. Aroma of light herb and perhaps a hint of salt. Med body at least. Theres a sour tang, supported by a little salt. There is a little herb or perhaps something like lime. Although the individual flavors, except sour, arent strong, the whole may be greater than the sum of the parts.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear pale yellow color with a fizzy white head. Aroma a light citrusy tart character with a touch of saltiness. Flavor is mildly tart, but not overbearing, salt is a little more hidden than a typical gose. More on the cascade sour character. Light in body with a lingering dry tartness and a touch of saltiness. Very tasty!
750ml, caged and corked bottle. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized white head. Citrus, wheat, some yeatiness, spice and a salty finish.

had on tap at the barrel house. pours light gold, translucent. nose has corriander. light tartness, salt, nice corriander level. light bodhi. this bottle will not make tge flight ho,e but thats ok got time thursday to grab another.

Bottle shared by Bruce. Aroma of lemonade mix, citrus peel, and slight sour grape. Pours hazy blonde with nice bubbles and a small head. Taste is pleasant with lemon peel, apricot, white wine, and salt. Very light and easy to drink, nothing too sour or intense going on. Was expecting different from Cascade but was happy nonetheless.

Bottle / $30 / from bottle shop next to Ballast Point. Shared with Linh, Will and Caroline. Pours a hazy orange with large white foamy head. Aroma is citrus fruits, lemon, light salt and 7-up. Mouthfeel is super light, light bubbles on the palate with notes of citrus fruits - oranges and lemons, light salty tart character and light dryness.

Received 750 ml bottle via trade with 5000. Pours a hazed golden straw colored brew with a fast dissipating white head that dissipates clean. Aroma of coriander, a hint of sea salt, and a touch of lemon zest. Taste is medium bodied, mild funk with flavors of pear, earthy herbs, white pepper and sea salt. Finish has mild tart funkiness with some sea salt, pear and coriander aftertaste.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks man! pours hazy if not cloudy pale yellow-greyish with a very nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. dusty lemons, fresh coriander and miscellaneous bitter herbs - very nicely integrated fragrant herbs, gently lactic - spot-on!, grassy and peppery, slight oakiness, salt and other mineral: traces. lively carbonation, light body - oily, balanced woodsy-grassy-spicy-herbal finish. very good!

Sour and slightly herbal nose (coriander). Hazy light pale yellow pour with a slight white head. One of the least sour Cascade sours that I have had. Really nice salty with some nice subtle coriander. Yummy.Earlier Rating: 8/17/2012 Total Score: 3.7Hazy yellow, almost no head, minimal lacing. Spicy lemon nose. Tart funky lemon spicy goodness.

Pour out of 750 ml bottle, hazy yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of coriander, phenolic notes, pepper, some bread, touch of pear and white grape. Taste is a mix of slight salt, lots of coriander, hints of lemon, bread, some hints of grain, finishing tart, dry. Pretty tasty, but a bit of

Bottle (750 ml). From kbudd19, thanks! Almost clear bright golden with a small persistent white head and little lacing. Aroma is quite interesting with light sourness, light sweetness, coriander, oak, lemon, hints of salt and light earthy notes. Taste is slightly sour with light sweetness, oak, coriander, lemon and hints of salt. Medium body (heavy for the style, but not too heavy either). Moderate carbonation. Clean. Very light salty finish. Dry. A bit heavy for the style, but mightily tasty, drinkable and quenching. I love it.

Bottle. Pale slightly cloudy blond wit decent white head. Aroma feels fresh: lemon, white flowers and coriander. Taste is addictive with a well-dosed salt presence along with a lemony and also lactic sourness. Appropriate med-lively carbonation. As good as it can get for a American interpretation of a german style.

Bottle at DC Epic Sour Tasting 2014, courtesy of MrChopin, thank you sir! Hazy golden amber color, medium fluffy white had. Aroma of tart lemon and orange peel. Taste is slightly bready bright orange and lemon. Sour and tart. Very tasty.Earlier Rating: 7/6/2013 Total Score: 3.7Draft at the source. Cloudy pale chalky yellow color, white edge head. Aroma of earthy straw. Taste is earthy lemon. Full bodied. Nice.
Bottle, shared at RBAG 2014, I believe by Kevin. Cloudy light yellow, frothy white head. Lightly citric, wet hair, subtle salt. A mild gose.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bottle to goblet at RBAG14
Salt, lemon, and vinegar. Sludgy yellow but no head. Taste is salt and lemon.

Bottle from Dak, shared at RBAG. Yellow pour with fizzy white head. Aroma is salt, citrus, and light spices. Taste is lemon citrus, salt, very crisp with a light refreshing finish. Good drink for a hot summer day.

Bottle - Light sourness and slat, with a lemony citrus. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Light lemon and a salty finish. Light and mellow. Quite refreshing.Earlier Rating: 1/16/2014 Total Score: 3.3Draft - A light lemon sourness. Pale yellow with a thin bubbly whit head. Lemon citrus acid and sourness with a salty finish. Although very refined, not my favorite Gose.

Clear yellow orange in color... Aroma of light salt, coriander, lemon zest, floral perfume... Flavor is fairly crisp and mild, not overwhelmingly tart, some cider notes, lime, salt, coriander... Refreshing, slightly watery, good for a hot day

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 1/28/2013 Total Score: 3.3Slightly acidic nose.... Flavor is slightly sour but not as sour as I hoped, notes of vinegar and oak... Decent

Bottle at the brewery. Pour is clear golden with a small white head and good lacing. White pepper, coriander, lemony, citrusy, biscuit, lightly grassy and lime juice in the aroma. Taste is bright lime juice, basil, coriander, lightly salty, and biscuit with a lightly tart finish. Medium body with high carboantion. One of the most balanced Cascade beers I have ever had.

At cascade brewpub with Taylor, Stephen, and Dina. Pours neon orange almost no head. Sour orange zest, fresh, light acidity. Taste is salty fizzy citrus, coriander. Nice, but a little salty and acidic to be super drinkable.

Bottle- thanks Brian! Pours cloudy golden, small head, minimal lacing. Aroma is light grass, hay, lemon. Flavor is light tart, a bit spicy, very light sweetness, a bit of funk. Light body, low carbonation.

Sample @ RBWG, Asheville. Gold pour, slightly hazy. Pretty robust mineral on the nose. Salt mine, pennies, a beachside stroll. Tropical fruit flavors enliven things a bit. Mango and faint suggestions of herbs. Dry finish. Slightly salty. Light body, soft carbonation. Great stuff. Eminently drinkable.

Thanks to 5000 for sending this bottle my way. Yellow pour with a white head. The aroma has some light lemon notes as well as some salt. The flavor is similar. The lemon and wheat notes are complemented by the salt and a light bit of tartness. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Very nice beer.
Pours a hazy gold with no head. Aroma of coriander, wheat, lemon. Taste is sour, salt, wheat and coriander. Nice Gose.

Bottle thanks to bill..Pour is yellow..Nose is salt, spice, corriander, nice tartness
...Taste is salt, yeast, funk, spice..

Bottle shared at Proof courtesy of David: Murky yellow. Salty lightly tart aroma. Light crisp sweet lemon. even - tho needed little more umph - more salt / tart. Good and drinkable though. 7.2Earlier Rating: 9/26/2013 Total Score: 3.9On tap at the barrel house. murky yellow. Wheat lemon aroma, Tastes same with light lemon salt tart bite. Peppery spice only sneaks through a little. 7.8

Poured at the de garde 1st anniversary - Pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma has light tartbness, wheat and mild spice. Its light bodid with lots of semi-sharp carbonation. it begins with mild tartness, hints of spice and mustiness. The finish is crisp and displays the salt bite. Pretty good.

hazy lemon gold, thin white ring. Salt and lemon nose, faint wheat and no salt. Flavor is vitamin c across front, mid is wheat and citrus, jowl tingling before the doughy end. More salt but balanced and well rounded otherwise, definitely the best Cascade Ive had of the last 30+, and aside from the slight vitamin c mistakes, one of the truest for a hot style being repeatedly mis-brewed of late.

Excellent for style. Lots of orange flavour in here, adds to very tart finish. Pours orange with good head and lacing. Some floral yeast in this. Well balanced. Thanks to MrChopin at Epic Sour Tasting.

Bottle (2012) shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting, thanks MrChopin! Hazy lemon yellow with off-white head. Aromas of salt, herbs and spices, lemon. Tastes of salt, citrus, tart fruit, lemon. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice gose.
From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Thanks MrChopin! Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Flavors of salty bandaids.
Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small wispy head. Aroma is light sweet and tart malts, some mild salt. Flavor is light tartness, some stonefruits. Not bad!
Thanks to MrChopin! Cloudy gold. Really bright for the style and impressively restrained for the brewery; soft brine, apricot, coriander and hints of herb. Clean and crisp. Really well done.
Pours a cloudy yellow in appearance with a white head. Really soft pineapple, bright juicy aroma.Very nice sour with some salt notes on the finish. Lots of juice.

750ml bottle from the brewpub. Split with my bride. Pours a clear, bright yellow color with a white head. Aroma is citrus, lemon, some oak. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is lightly sour, tart, lemon, oak, familiar cascade funk, with a light, tart finish. Not as clean as some Goses, but very nice, very much Cascade.

This is headless, cloudy and yellow. There is a bit of pineapple in the nose along w/ some citrus. This ha a bit of a wheaty thickness to it and is medium tart. This is lemony and crisp w/a bit of sweetness that linger in the finish. The carbonation is a bit prickly but it work for the style. Definitely a nice take on gose overall.
750ml bottle. Dry and semi-salty ale that is much more authentic than many of the goses being shopped around in the us nowadays.

2012 Vintage
Tasted on 2/7/14 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle at the Friday night tasting at RBWG Asheville, thanks to jcnielsen for sharing. Pours murky pale yellow with a thick white head that slowly recedes to thick lace, sticking to the inside of the glass. The nose is preserved lemon and lemon jam with a touch of wheat malt. The flavor is tart and salty with the same lemon jam. The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long salty and tart finish.

Bottle:   Bright, slightly dry, a little carbonation, with a bit of lime finishing it off.   Says Corriander on the bottle, but doesnt seem that citrusy, seems more like lime.   Hard to believe this is 7.5%, bigger than most Gose.   Enjoyable, soft, decent carbonation, dry, lime like, did I mention dry?   Doesnt seem like 7.5% which is fine by me.   Seems to have the right combination of sweetness, salt,  and fruitiness.   Well done Cascade!

750 ml bottle at the RBWG Friday night tasting. Pours a super pale yellow color, hazy, with a white ring for a head. Notes of lemon, lime, salt, and wheat - kind of like lemon-lime Gatorade. Light-bodied, with a tart, dry mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Good gose.

[ Bottle ][ RBWG Afterparty2 ][ 750mL ][ Globe ][ Tasting ][ 2/7/14 ]
>> Pours cloudy white with fizzing out foam. Nose is fresh buttercream, lemon cake frosting, fresh biscuit. Taste is aerated, lemon, lightly tart and refreshing. Palate is aerated, buoyant, quenching. Liked. Earlier Rating: 10/17/2013 Total Score: 3.5Tap at Cascade. Pours a low haze straw with mega sheets of white lacing. Nose is candied lemon, bubblegum, mega white grape juice box. Taste is sweet white grape juice, salt, lime, but not enough to balance the sweetness. Palate is lactic, citric, buoyant. Nice but a bit sugary for me.

15th February 2014Scopey 5K Tasting in deepest Croydonia. Thanks to Bruce. Hazy pale gold beer, small white head. Palate is light and airy with moderate minerally crispness. Very light sherbet fruits, not too sharp. Not getting any savoury character here which is a shame as it would elevated this already tasty beer. Finishes light and dry. Mild fruity bitter linger.

Bottle split at Scopeys 5K Extravaganza of Oompah Band meets doorbell music, massive thanks to Bruce - 15/02/14. 2012 Project.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is tarte apple skins, straw, lemon rind, touch of orange.
Taste comprises peach, sour bread, orange peel, apple core, melon.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent stuff.
Earlier Rating: 11/25/2012 Total Score: 3.7Tap at the Pine Box, Seattle - 08/11/12.
Hazed mid amber/yellow with a thin off white head that soon clears to the edge and leaves a small film.
Nose is sour, peaches, gooseberries, lemon curd, MKI radiatior piss accident (or deliberate!).
Tastes of sour bitter lemon, light honey notes, sour apples, touch of vinegar.
Medium bodied with light spritzy carbonation leading to a tarte finish.
Excellent palate cleansing fayre!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Scopeys 5000th rate. Bottle thanks to Bruce. A hazy-ish orange pour with a very thick white head leaving very sticky lacing. Nose is big orange and lemon peel, huge sherbert and nice zest. Taste is sherbert forward, very lemon driven, citric zest and a touch of spiciness on the finish. Only qualm is it has alittle bit of soapiness but other than that it is very quaffable. So light and refreshing. Nice stuff

Bottle at RBWG 2014, thanks! Pours z hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has an earthy wheat and light fruit note with a touch of spice that works well. Flavor has a great growing tartness with light fruit and a bit of wheat underlying. Very drinkable.

Bottle at my 5K tasting, thanks to Bruce. It pours hazy gold with a thick white head. The nose is earthy, barnyard, dough, soft fruits, ad a lick of spice. The taste is crisp, tart, earthy, barnyard, funk, salty edge, minerals, sherbet, doughy and a touch of spice/herbal, with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Good full mouth-feel for this style. Well rounded and damn tasty. A great gose!

On tap at Cascade Barrel Room. Pale yellow with a thin layer of white head. Maybe I just didnt get this style but this seemed artificial and plasticy with a light sourness and a stale caramel and watered down thin finish. Oddly enough though I did find it refreshing and and light on the palate...
Bottle at RBWG Downtown Inn late night tasting. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nose and taste of salt, lemon, sour wheat. Lighter Medium body. Straight forward but well executed.
Bottle shared during some post-bus drinking at the Downtown Inn for RBWG. Solid gose. Moderately lactic with a decent amount of coriander. A slight salinity in the finish.
Bottle at RBWG, courtesy of someone. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Sweet, lemon, tart, lemonade flavors.
Lightly hazed yellow pour with white head. Aroma is light sour apple. Flavor is medium sour and a light tart finish. Medium body with good carbonation.

750ml bottle, taster from it. Mostly hazy, pale yellow color. Thin white head. Some loose dots of lace. Very nice, big wheat, light coriander in the aroma. Moderate tart, lightly zesty. Medium to bigger body, bigger than the 5% abv might suggest. Nice gose. Mild salt to it. A good, refreshing gose.
Bottle @ RBWG Fart Share. Pours a cloudy yellow appearance with a white head. Really soft pineapple, bright juicy aroma. Fucken delicious. Some salt. Lots of juice. Awesome.

Bottle thanks to Vasili ! Pours a hazy yellow golden color with two fingers of tight bubbled fizzy foam. The nose is crisp with underlying lacto tartness, grainy wheat, sea water seltzer and touches of lemon. The palate follows the nose with an aggressive carbonation and crisp finish. A bit restrained on the tartness but the balance of lemon, grainy wheat and salty minerality made it worth trying !

750ml bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours cloudy pale yellow with medium head. Nose is earthy fruity tangy citrus and lemon. Taste is crisp fruity lemonade, minerality, lacto. Finish is tart lacto grains and wheat, lemon, lime. Solid.

750mL 2012 project bottle listed at 7.5% ABV. Thanks daknole! 
Aroma has a moderate coriander character with some medium light wheat notes. Faint fruit esters and just a hint of sourness. 
Pours a cloudy, pale yellow gold with a thin, pillowy, white head that subsides fairly quickly to the edges even though bubbles continue to rise and replenish it. Light lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor has a medium tartness with a moderate amount of salt; this is definitely one of the saltier Goses that I have had, but also delicious. Medium wheat notes and moderate coriander flavor. Light citrus and tropical fruit. Low bitterness and faint alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty nice Gose, while the coriander and salt are delicious they a re also a bit too strong. This beer lacks the delicateness that I expect in nicer Goses. Easy drinking though and very enjoyable.

Had on draft at the Cascade Barrel House. The aroma is fruity coriander, slight acidity, slight salt, green apple. The flavor its lemon, salt, coriander, apple. This is great, I am always looking for a tasty Gose and this fits the bill.
Tap at Cascade Brewing, Portland. Colour is golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries and some sourness. Clean and simple.

Aroma: Sea Salt, Lemons, Mild Hay

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Salty, Lemons, Green Grape

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Salty, Mild Sour

04AUG12 review.

Love that this is a "slightly sour" its like they never traveled to Leipzig and drank the beer. This bitch is way more sour than the native versions Ive had.

Diaphonous grainy yellow with off-white, fleeting foam. Nose is briny and sour with some hints of grain, salt, pepper and yeast. The flavor is sour for the style - lemon, grain, hints of triscuits. The finish is a littles saliated and gives off a green olive brine character dominated with lactic tart. Thin and wet. This is a tasty beer, and I purchased a grenade of it, but I wouldnt place it too high among Goses.

Serving type: growler

08-07-2012
Tap at cascade. Cloudy yellowish color, white head. Flavors of yeast, wheat, lemons, light saline note, some spice. Really damn tasty and really drinkable.

On tap @ Cascade Brewing Barrel House. Pours hazy yellow with a finger thick head. Aroma is tart citrus with lemon peel and orange, as well as some salty spiciness. Normal body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour with tart fruity lemon and lemon peel, as well as salt. Finishes of with a long tarty fruitiness ending with notes of sweetly lemon drops.

On tap at Cascade. Pale cloudy yellow, with huge white head. Smells like vinegar (in a good way) and white wine. Flavor is champaigne, with a hint of salt. White wine, woody notes as it warms. Very tasty...

Clouded pale yellow. Lacing is pretty intense. Nose is faint. Lots of lemon zest. Taste is figs and grapes, oak and lacto tartness. Pretty high acidity with citrus and cream. Very good. Might be good with apricots

On tap at the Barrel House. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. A big grassy and sour hey nose. The flavor is big hay, grass, light spices, a low sour flavor throughout. Very interesting. The wheat shows certainly.
Poured from the tap. Clear pale yellow with minimal white head. Very citrusy lemon nose with some wheat. Sweet, not tart, lemony wheat flavour. Medium body. Very nice.

On draught at cascade - pours out cloudy golden color with small frothy white head. Nose of tart fruit, grapefruit, and grass. Taste is of grapefruit, tart cherries, and lemon. Nice blended sour fruit taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught at Cascade Barrel House. Hazy cloudy dark yellow color. Aroma is sweet and tart lemon, close to a lemon bar. Taste is lemon, salt, sweet malt. Refreshing, smooth, and a sweet interpretation of the style.
Draft at barrelhouse. Lemon aroma up front with strong salt flavors initially. Finishes with a clean dryness. Slightly spicey with subtle tartness. Refreshing.
Milky yellow pour with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is salty sour, slightly medicinal. Would be excellent in a Bloody Mary.

Taster at tasting room. Aroma and flavor of a light pale, almost tart apple sour. Light on palate, not very sour yet tasty. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

The beer is pale yellow and clear, with minimal head that rapidly fades to nothing, leaving no lacing. The aroma is slightly sour and funky, with notes of citrus. The flavor is a step up from the aroma, with more salt presence. Nice citrus flavors. Slight sourness, but not puckering. The body is fairly thin, with low carbonation. Overall, a tasty beer. I would have this again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 10-02-2011

Tap @ PW. Hazy lemon-gold pour with a short white head with poor retention and leaving minimal lace. Nose is all sour and cinnamon. Medium-light body with light carbonation. Lemon juice, white grape, unripe berries, wheat, salt and a bit of butterscotch. Finish is still quite tart and slightly salty, with some citrus zest bitterness entering and a touch of barnyard funk. Prefer the winter and fall gose and some others, this one is really sour.
Pale straw colour. Bright tart lactic aroma. Lemon and a bit of wheat with a light berry character on the back. Intensely tart but clean with a nice bright note that I really dig. Awesome really.

Hazy light golden color with fleeting white head. Barnyard piss and dung, cherry,  tart citrus, dry pepper phenol aromas. Light bodied. Medium tart lemon, lactic flavors with white bread, grapefruit, cloves--good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Draft at sb. Pours a cloudy medium gold with a short-lived white head. Big tangy salty lemony nose. Creamy medium body with mild carb. Lemons, salt, and a bit of funk on the mid palate. Mildly tangy finish. Awesome.Earlier Rating: 8/18/2009 Total Score: 3.8growler thanks to scrizzzz. thanks, clint! pours hazy medium gold with a dense but fizzy and persistent white head. nice big lactic balsamic and lemon nose. creamy and somewhat fizzy medium body. definitely a little wheat sour and a bit of salt. beautifully made. probably awesome with food.
Pours hazy blond with a finger head. Smell is tart and lightly salty. Taste is salt up front and a lactic finish. I could drink this all day, simple but great..

Somewhat cloudy yellow, served in a lager glass; decent looking white head.  Aroma is tart with a unique sweet fruitiness that includes strawberry and pineapple!  Flavor are considerably sour with a slight malt foundation, and a touch of saltiness to go with it.  Great for the style!!!

Cloudy mustard gold. Layered, complex pineapple and other tropical fruits. Light to medium bodied. This drinks more like a Gueuze without Brett than a Leipzig Gose. Bright, acidic underripe nectarine flavors. Ends too abruptly.

On tap at the Barrel Room - Pours yellow with a white head. Nose has light tartness with lemony wheat. Taste is real tart vinegar with a clean, yeasty taste, real doughy with an abrupt finish. Nice fluffy body. My first gose!
Cascade night at Urban Family. Lemony haze, bright yellow. Still. Big fruity lemon, light funk before big tart lemon juiciness. Like a lemon warhead candy, but with an interesting funk bite.

Hazy banana wheat, but flat. Absolutely, unrestrained funky nose that is an explosion of fruits that collide with barnyard, wheat and sour notes. Lychee and papaya fruit are two of the most prominent. Sour tart body accompanied by sharp sweetness. Papaya and lemonade finish.
Pale yellow. Straw, lemongrass, and dilute yeast. Refreshing. Tartness lingers. Sharp (thanks, Ethan).
Delicious mild sour lemon beer. Great for summer. Straight forward sour, Bright personality. Beautiful color and light hops.
Draught at the Barrel House. Great lemon drop and yogurt nose. Glowing yellow pastel with lace. Sour lemon drop flavor, yogurt, coriander, and salt. Super soft and mellow. Wonderful and very summery.

On tap at Cascade Brewing, pours a cloudy blonde with a medium white head. Aroma of light spices, slight light fruit tartness. Flavour of lightly tart citrus fruits, some funk and zest. Very dry, lightly tart. Simple but decent.
Cloudy yellow pour with a small white head.  Light and refreshing but still with lots of nice flavor.  A nice tart bite with a little coriander spices.  Lots of lemony sourness.  Enjoyable.
CBC on tap-pours yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is medium fruit with some tart/acidic, light malt.  Taste follows.

Tap, toronado sd.  Pours a slightly hazed yellow with a ring of white atop.  Nose was softly tart & floral as well as somewhat sweet.  Flavors more of the same, sweet and floral with background tartness...but really, when I drink gose, I want discernable saltiness and Im not getting any here...I may or may not pick up the coriander, but its somewhat difficult with the level of sweetness going on here.  Its clean, sure..but maybe thats the problem, well, that and the fact that its far too sweet to be an accurate portrayal of gose.  Oh well.

Growler courtesy of drabmuh. Served in a snifter.

Pours a clear golden color with a small white head without much retention and no real lacing. The nose carries a slight cider character with a light bit of malt. The flavor is a tiny bit malty with a very light dosing of salt and a bit of a red-apple character. Mild cider. Light body with good carbonation and a slight dryness. Fairly good, though quite plain.

A: The beer pours a pale golden color with a finger of white head.

S: Unlike some the other Goses, Ive tried, there is really only a mild salt aroma to it. There is, however, a strong aroma of Fruit Loops cereal which a definite sweetness (and of course fruitiness). A light tartness of lemon and some mild bread and wheat. Maybe a touch earthy.

T: Still a light tartness, but a bit more pronounced than on the aroma. A decent amount of lemon along with the same Fruit Loops character. Some sweet malt and wheat bread with a bit of yeast, salt, and earth.

M: On the light side of medium bodied with medium to high carbonation.

O: Im not the huge Gose fan, but this was pretty nice and easy to drink.

A blonde gose with a thin white head. In aroma, smooth lightly sour malt with light salty points. In mouth, a light gode with corny malt, lightly lactic, not bad but rather light. Refreshing. On tap at brewpub July 31 2011.

ABV 5.5%. Golden color, small white head. Herbal hoppy, malty aroma. Light-bodied. Lemony hoppy, coriander spicey with sweetish maltyness. Coriander-tuned German pils.
On tap at Raccoon Lodge. Pours out golden with a small white ring of a head. Aroma was spice, lemon zest, and some sweet malt. Taste was much as the aroma with a fair amount of spice and citrus.
Said to be about 4% abv... Nutty, grainy nose. Light body, crisp and tart taste. Lively. Very pleasant and Id like more.

Draught from Uber tavern. Gold appearance and slightly hazy. Not much head to speak of. Nice aroma of lemons and a little bit of funkiness is kicking in there as well. Its not that pungent, but I get enough of this hitting my nostrils to make a judgment. Very smooth texture. Taste is of lemons, wheat, and a little bit of salt. The salt didnt have that much of an effect, but it did have enough to where I could notice. Slightly funky/tart at the end, but nothing ridiculous. Very enjoyable seeing that I had about three of these back-to-back.

draft.  clear gold.  musty herbal nose.  light honey and biscuit malt approach; mild lime zest and salt character mid-palate; mild to medium coriander in the finish; leans to the sweet side of things.  some musty creamed wheat character at times.  very thin body, extremely thin finish.  uninspiring.

Sampled on tap at the brewpub.  Totally clear, bright gold with a thin, white head.  Crisp aroma, wheat, straw, light citrus, a touch of yeast.  The flavor was outwardly salty, pale malts, a touch sweet.  Medium bodied, salty finish.  The saltiness of this gose comes through well.

On tap, clear golden with no head, peachy lemon aroma with great sour 
flavor of wheat, lemon and peaches

On tap at the Racoon Lodge.  Very light, straw colored pour with a moderate ivory head that left spotty lacing.  Aroma is of citrus, lemon, and biscuit.  Flavor has a certain salty/briney quality accompanied by wheat and lemonpeel.  Medium mouthfeel.  Refreshing.
On tap at Collins. Pours apricot with no head. Vinegar, pear, sugar, with a slightly skunky smell. Tastes much better, of fuzzy peach, spritzer, pear, and of course sourness.

Tap. Very light color obviously, thick fluffy white head. Light aroma of funky wheat, flavor is crisp and lovely light fruitiness, salt finish. This was a great beer for the hot humid day that was yesterday, very refreshing but nice depth of flavor.

On tap. Pours with a a large white head over a somewhat chill hazy golden body. Aroma of champagne, grapes, herbs, salt, coriander, perfume, lavender, and suntan lotion. Flavors of wheat, salt, lactic acid, coriander and sage. Dry and refreshing mouthfeel. Solid.

Now were talking.   I was a bit worried after the winter gose (not very gose-like) but this pretty much nailed it.   From the tap at the brewpub this pours a hazy straw color with almost no head.   The aroma is fragrant and spicy with coriander, lemon, and flowers.   The flavor spicy, tangy, and savory, with a light saltiness adding nicely to the sourness and spice.   Very drinkable and well balanced.   Finishes with a very light sweetness and low bitterness.   Light bodied with high carbonation.   Good stuff.
Wow did this smell bad. Not farmhouse stinky just bad stinky. Not getting the savory salt typical of hose but this is a nice sour once you get used to the aroma.

Half pint on tap at the brewpub.  Aroma is quite floral with some fruity peach/apricot-like esters present.  Lightly sweet and pretty quaffable.  Moderately hazy dark golden body with a quickly dissipating small white head.  Starts a little tart with a really fine, effervescent carbonation.  Almost champagne-like.  Has a nice wheat body with some lingering tartness.  Nice floral notes with some soft salty notes present to finish.  Very champagne-like,  Refreshing and enjoyable.

Verre de 12 oz, au Raccoon Lodge. Arômes épicées et florales, bonne touche de céréales et légère pointe dacidité. Robe pêche et trouble, peu de mousse et effervescence moyenne. Plutôt mince en bouche, on retrouve une base de céréales sûrettes et une touche épicée. Le sel, normalement retrouvé dans ce style, napparaît pas vraiment. Finale légèrement lactique. Rafraîchissant et pas mauvais, mais jespérais mieux de Cascade.

Tap @ Cascade/Raccoon Lodge...  They really hit the mark with this one.  Far superior than the very first Gose the attempted last summer.  Poured golden with a thin white head into a stemmed glass.  Tart, tangy with notes of herbs, and subtle sourness that is always welcomed and familiar on Gansbergs great beers.Earlier Rating: 7/18/2009 Total Score: 3.3Tap @ PIB...  Poured a hazy, pale golden with a white head.  Funky, yeasty and wheat aroma.  Tangy flavors with wheat and spiced, weed-like notes.  Earthy and herbal and the salt created a nice balance.
on tap at saraveza, nice and tangy semi-sour ale. crisp finishes and a good balance
Draft. Amber beer with a whitish head. Tart, light fruit aroma. Sour/tart flavor with cranberry. Medium bodied. Sourness lingers with cranberry and light salt.

On tap at the PIB. Cloudy gold with a tall white head. Big spicy nose of citrus zest, coriander, and pepper. Crisp and dry, I didnt find the salt left much of an impression, but had a nice tart finish to it, very refreshing.

growler - thanks scrizzz!! clear, faint gold with fuzzy white head; tart on the nose with mild funk, orange, grain and grapes; soft, fuzzy texture that drinks like a heavy berliner weisse ; plenty of brine on the nose and creates a very dry finish; quite interesting and in the end, very tasty

Had this on tap today at Belmont Station in Portland, OR.  Colour... very light golden with scarcely any head. Nose... funky, lightly sour and slightly citrusy. Palate... mod. C02, lightly tangy, mildly funky, sweaty and a salty somewhat citrusy crispness to the finish. Rather like a Berliner weiss.
Lemon, salt, feet and manfunk.  Yeah its salty, hints of lemon.  Very delicate and refreshing.

Wheat, some salted notes, sone tart lactic notes underneath akin to a berlinner weiss. Hazy golden orange with a thin foamy head. Salty wheat malt, lactic tartnes.zesty lively carbonation. A little salt watery in the finish. Light, delicate, and refreshing with really nice subtle flavors.

Mystery Tap at PIB. Was a light, hazy golden color with a small white head. Honestly, the only thing I could think of while drinking this beer was popcorn. It had the aroma and flavor of butter, salt and corn, and the overwhelming feeling from the palate was of butter. Quite the letdown, and possibly the beer I enjoyed least at the event.
